tool.name: mitoRiboUmi
tool.command: ln -s $input /scratch/matrix.${format} && #if str($reference_gtf.source) == "history": ln -s $reference_gtf.own_file /scratch/file.gtf && #else: ln -s $reference_gtf.gtf.fields.path /scratch/file.gtf && #end if ####Rscript /home/main.R Buettner csv , Mus_musculus.GRCm38.95.gtf protein_coding 3 Rscript $__tool_directory__/main.R matrix $format $Separator file.gtf $biotype $umiXgene && mv /scratch/Ribo_mito.pdf $output

param.name: source
param.label: Will you select a ensembl gtf from your history or use a built-in gtf?
param.help: Built-ins were downloaded from ensembl ftp at https://www.ensembl.org/info/data/ftp/index.html
param.option: Use a gtf from the history

validator.message: No gtfs are available for the selected input dataset

param.name: umiXgene
param.help: a integer defining how many UMI are required to call a gene as present

tool.help: mitoriboumi plots the cells according to the number of significative genes, mitochondrial and ribosomal genes percentage.
